official-title.#text:
To provide for the withdrawal of the United States from
		  the North American Free Trade Agreement.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
Withdrawal of the United
			 States from the NAFTA

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall cease to be effective beginning on the date that is six months after the
			 date of the enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 101(a) of the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act/s:101/ss:a

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any
			 other provision of law, the approval of the NAFTA by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide to the Governments of Canada
			 and Mexico written notice of withdrawal of the United States from the NAFTA in
			 accordance with Article 2205 of the NAFTA.

text.#text:
On the date of the
			 enactment of this Act, the

term.#tail:
means the
			 North American Free Trade Agreement entered into between the United States,
			 Canada, and Mexico on December 17, 1992.
